subject: History
title: Stalingrad: The Turning Point
description: Learn Stalingrad: The Turning Point in one minute.

hook.text: The Battle of Stalingrad was the deadliest battle in human history. Nearly two million people were killed or wounded.

buildup.text: In 1942, Hitler ordered the capture of Stalingradâ€”partly for its industrial value, partly because it bore Stalin's name.

discovery.text: Soviet defenders fought building by building, floor by floor. Snipers and small units turned the ruins into a trap.

twist.text: The Soviets launched Operation Uranusâ€”a massive counterattack that encircled the entire German 6th Army.

climax.text: Starving and freezing, 91,000 German soldiers surrendered in February 1943. Only 6,000 ever returned home.

punchline.text: The city that bore Stalin's name became Hitler's grave.

quiz.question: What was the outcome of the Battle of Stalingrad?
options: Germany captured the city and advanced to Moscow
The Soviets encircled and destroyed the German 6th Army, turning the war
Both sides agreed to a ceasefire and split the city
